intro: Hesperoscordum lewisii, commonly known as Lewis's fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces yellow flowers in clustered umbels. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
